main event: On September 1, 1954, in Pasco, Washington, a bright, stationary object with no sound or smell was observed from the terrain for about 2 minutes. The object then became a filter center/AML radar which received a similar report from the same location. Additionally, on September 7, 1954, there was a report of a sighting of an unidentified object traveling with a larger object in the same area.
interesting points: The observed object was estimated to be approximately 12 feet in diameter and appeared to be metallic and saucer-shaped.
The object was observed to have no vertical or horizontal stabilizer and displayed oscillating motion with no trail of exhaust.
It made a rapid move covering about one quarter of the visible sky and then returned to its original position.
The sighting was also reported by an employee of the Northern Pacific and a passenger of the company's aircraft.
The larger object observed on September 7, 1954 disappeared before an accurate description could be obtained, leaving its method of disappearance unknown.
sighted object: Bright, stationary object on September 1, 1954. Unidentified object sighted on September 7, 1954.
witnesses: Employee of the Northern Pacific, passenger of the company's aircraft
